channel.title: How to get past parental blocking!(works)(pics)
channel.description:
For the people hew have mean parent's that want to block websites on your computer.So this will make the program that your parents put on your comp not start up...If it doesn't start up that means you can now go to the sites that it was blocking.I know this works with all security program's cause all computer's can change these setting's.(i have pc-cillin 2007).
[b]Step 1:[/b]Go to start then click run...
[IMG]http://i18.photobucket.com/albums/b147/everboy123/1.jpg[/img]
[b]Step 2:[/b]Now in run type..
[code]msconfig[/code]
[IMG]http://i18.photobucket.com/albums/b147/everboy123/2.jpg[/img]
Then this should pop up...
[IMG]http://i18.photobucket.com/albums/b147/everboy123/3.jpg[/img]
[b]Step 3:[/b]Now under the General Tab you should have normal startup checked..Instead of that we want to check Selective Startup.Then uncheck Load Startup Items.
[IMG]http://i18.photobucket.com/albums/b147/everboy123/4.jpg[/img]
[b]Step 4:[/b]Then go to the Services Tab and click Hide All Microsoft Service's..Now you should see the security thing that you parents are using to block site's with. uncheck the ones beside your security program.
[IMG]http://i18.photobucket.com/albums/b147/everboy123/5.jpg[/img]
[b]Step 5:[/b]Then something like this should pop up...Saying you have to restart comp.(yes u must restart comp for this to work)
[IMG]http://i18.photobucket.com/albums/b147/everboy123/6-1.jpg[/img]
[b]Step 6:[/b]Click restart and when your computer comes back on you should be able to go any site cause your security thing should turn on.To turn it back to normal just go to start>run and type in msconfig and check normal startup.
credit:My friend Steven...

item.title: How to get past parental blocking!(works)(pics)
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“Gotta Catch Them All, post:13, topic:65102”][quote author=mrrules link=topic=94580.msg1001539#msg1001539 date=1173662151]
Ty guys :)…Im trying to see if i can do this with school comps
[/quote]

We don’t have “run” on our school computers. -.-[/quote]

Pretty sure you could get round that in safe mode…

Also i just used this technique to get all my processes down to the minimum amount needed. My sexy computer runs so fast now! TY

Read full topic

item.title: How to get past parental blocking!(works)(pics)
item.dc:creator: @mrrules mrrules
item.description:
@mrrules wrote:

Yea same here…Wonder what i can do in the windows folder? (i ca get to the windows folder at my school) If you want to try just open something like powerpoint (what i used) or paint , word , movie maker…Soemthing like that and then go to open (as in opening a word doc , pic on paint or powerpoint) and click down on the drop down box and you shoulf see my document’s control panel (won’t have anything in it) and you should see local C:.

item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

mrrules:

My parent’s don’t pay attention to the icon’s in the corner…Plus there never on my comp…And if i didn’t have this blocking thing on i wouldn’t be aloud on the comp.(don’t ask why)

someone got busted choking the chicken…

and nice tutorial. I’m lucky not to have this, but if I did, it would mean I’m a complete dumb ass (no offense), and therefor would find this tut completely necessary. good job

item.title: How to get past parental blocking!(works)(pics)
item.dc:creator: @mrrules mrrules
item.description:
@mrrules wrote:

For the people hew have mean parent’s that want to block websites on your computer.So this will make the program that your parents put on your comp not start up…If it doesn’t start up that means you can now go to the sites that it was blocking.I know this works with all security program’s cause all computer’s can change these setting’s.(i have pc-cillin 2007).

Step 1:Go to start then click run…

1.jpg800×600

Step 2:Now in run type…

msconfig

2.jpg800×600

Then this should pop up…

3.jpg800×600

Step 3:Now under the General Tab you should have normal startup checked…Instead of that we want to check Selective Startup.Then uncheck Load Startup Items.

4.jpg800×600

Step 4:Then go to the Services Tab and click Hide All Microsoft Service’s…Now you should see the security thing that you parents are using to block site’s with. uncheck the ones beside your security program.

5.jpg800×600

Step 5:Then something like this should pop up…Saying you have to restart comp.(yes u must restart comp for this to work)

6-1.jpg800×600

Step 6:Click restart and when your computer comes back on you should be able to go any site cause your security thing should turn on.To turn it back to normal just go to start>run and type in msconfig and check normal startup.

credit:My friend Steven…

Read full topic
